DESCRIPTION:THIS AWARD PROVIDES FUNDS TO CLARK FORK RIVER TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE COMMITTEE (CFRTAC) ENABLING THE RECIPIENT TO ACQUIRE INDEPENDENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND CONDUCT COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION REGARDING THE SUPERFUND ACTIVITIES AT THE CLARK FORK RIVER BASIN SUPERFUND SITE.ACTIVITIES:REVIEW AND PROVIDE COMMENT ON WORK PLANS, REPORTS, AND VARIOUS OTHER COMMUNICATIONS UNDERTAKEN BY THE US ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY, OTHER SUPPORTING AGENCIES, AND RESPONSIBLE PARTIES REGARDING THE CLARK FORK RIVER BASIN SUPERFUND SITES. INTERPRET HIGHLY TECHNICAL AGENCY SUPERFUND RELATED DOCUMENTS INTO SIMPLER LANGUAGE THE LOCAL AFFECTED COMMUNITY CAN UNDERSTAND. HOLD PUBLIC MEETINGS TO GO OVER DECISIONS THAT ARE TO BE MADE REGARDING THE CLARK FORK RIVER BASIN SUPERFUND SITE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:MEANINGFUL AND EFFECTIVE COMMUNICATION BETWEEN THE COMMUNITY AND THE AGENCIES (EPA, DEQ, LOCAL GOVERNMENT), LEADING TO EPA AND DEQ INCLUSION OF COMMUNITY NEEDS AND INTERESTS INTO PROJECT DECISION-MAKING TO HELP ENSURE A HIGH-QUALITY REMEDY. TECHNICAL REVIEWS SUPPORTING HIGHER QUALITY WORK PLANS, REPORTS AND REMEDIAL ACTIONS. SUPPORTING SUPERFUND REMEDY DEVELOPMENT BY HELPING TO IDENTIFY FUTURE SITE REUSE GOALS AND MANAGEMENT. INCREASED AWARENESS AND UNDERSTANDING IN THE COMMUNITY OF THE NEED FOR AND BENEFITS OF SUPERFUND CLEANUP. THE BENEFICIARY OF THESE OUTCOMES ARE BOTH THE CITIZENS AFFECTED BY THE SUPERFUND SITE AND THE AGENCIES INVOLVED IN MAKING DECISIONS REGARDING THE CLARK FORK RIVER BASIN SUPERFUND SITE. THE COMMUNITY LIVING NEAR THE SUPERFUND SITE BENEFITS BY HAVING A TECHNICAL ADVISOR THAT CAN HELP THEM BETTER UNDERSTAND THE TECHNICAL DOCUMENTS PERTAINING THE SUPERFUND SITE AND THE AGENCIES BENEFIT IN HAVING AN EDUCATED PUBLIC THAT CAN PROVIDE COMMENTS THAT COULD BE CONSIDERED ESSENTIAL PRIOR TO DECISIONS MADE FOR THE SUPERFUND SITE.

GREAT SWAMP WATERSHED ASSOCIATION WILL USE FUNDS TO HELP THE COMMUNITY AFFECTED BY THE ROLLING KNOLLS SUPERFUND SITE TO UNDERSTAND INFORMATION CONTAINED IN TECHNICAL DOCUMENTS PREPARED BY EPA, OR THE PARTIES PERFORMING WORK RELATED TO HAZARDOUS WASTE SITE CLEANUP AND TO UNDERSTAND THE ISSUES AND DECISIONS THAT NEED TO BE MADE RELATED TO SITE CLEANUP.  AN INDEPENDENT TECHNICAL ADVISOR(S) WILL BE PROCURED BY GREAT SWAMP WATERSHED ASSOCIATION TO REVIEW AND INFORM THE COMMUNITY ON DOCUMENTS RELATED TO THE SITE CLEANUP.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE DUWAMISH RIVER CLEANUP COALITION/TECHNICAL ADVISORY GROUP TO REVIEW DOCUMENTS RELATED TO THE HARBOR ISLAND SUPERFUND SITE AND ASSIST THE COMMUNITY IN UNDERSTANDING SITE-RELATED ISSUES AND INFORMATION.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO: TECHNICAL DOCUMENT REVIEW AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO: COMMENTS ON TECHNICAL DOCUMENTS, ANALYSIS AND REPORTING ON TECHNICAL DOCUMENTS, FACT SHEETS, ATTENDANCE AT MEETINGS, AND HOSTING COMMUNITY MEETINGS.  ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO: A WELL-INFORMED, ENGAGED COMMUNITY THAT CAN MEANINGFULLY PARTICIPATE IN THE CLEANUP DECISION MAKING PROCESS.  THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE COMMUNITIES AND STAKEHOLDERS IMPACTED BY THE CONTAMINATION AT THE HARBOR ISLAND SUPERFUND SITE IN SEATTLE, WASHINGTON.

THE STATUTORY AUTHORITY FOR THIS PROJECT IS CERCLA 117(E) AS AMENDED BY 42 USC 9617(E). THE STATUTE AUTHORIZES TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE GRANTS TO GROUPS OF INDIVIDUALS AFFECTED BY OR THREATENED BY A RELEASE AT A SUPERFUND SITE TO OBTAIN INDEPENDENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE IN INTERPRETING SITE-RELATED DOCUMENTS AND IN DISSEMINATING THIS INFORMATION TO THE REST OF THE COMMUNITY.  UNDER THIS PROJECT, THE GRANTEE WILL REVIEW THE PORTLAND HARBOR SUPERFUND CLEANUP SITE DOCUMENTS AND ASSIST THE COMMUNITY IN UNDERSTANDING SITE-RELATED ISSUES AND INFORMATION.

THIS GRANT AGREEMENT TO THE EAST CHICAGO CALUMET COALITION COMMUNITY ADVISORY GROUP (ECCC CAG) ALLOWS FOR A TECHNICAL ADVISOR (TA) TO REVIEW REPORTS COMPLETED BY UNITED STATE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (USEPA) AND PREPARE DOCUMENTATION WHICH WILL EXPLAIN USEPA'S FINDINGS OR RESOLUTIONS TO THE MEMBERS OF THE GROUP AND THE AFFECTED AREA.

THIS GRANT AGREEMENT TO THE PINE RIVER TASK FORCE WILL  ALLOW FOR THE HIRING OF A TECHNICAL ADVISOR WHO WILL EXPLAIN TO THE RESIDENTS IN THE AREA HOW THE U.S. ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) PROPOSES TO RECTIFY THE CONTAMINATION AT THE VELSICOL BURN PIT IN ST. LOUIS, MICHIGAN.

WOOD TREATERS SUPERFUND SITE AND DISSEMINATE THIS INFORMATION TO THE AFFECTED COMMUNITY.

THIS ACTION PROVIDES PARTIAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $25,000 TO THE NAVASSA COMMUNITY ECONOMIC & ENVIRONMENTAL RE-DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION.  FUNDS WILL BE USED TO HIRE INDEPENDENT TECHNICAL ADVISOR(S) TO REVIEW INFORMATION GENERATED AS A RESULT OF CLEANUP ACTIVITIES AT THE KERR-MCGEE SUPERFUND SITE IN NAVASSA, NORTH CAROLINA.  THE TECHNICAL ADVISOR(S) WILL HELP THE AFFECTED COMMUNITY TO UNDERSTAND INFORMATION CONTAINED IN THE EPA TECHNICAL DOCUMENTS RELATED TO HAZARDOUS WASTE SITE CLEANUP AND ALLOW THEM TO MORE MEANINGFULLY PARTICIPATE IN THE CLEANUP DECISION-MAKING PROCESS.
